definitions.definition: material made by weaving wool, cotton, silk, etc., used for making clothes, curtains, etc. and for covering furniture

examples.text: They sell a wide variety of printed cotton fabric.
The fabric is woven on these machines.
fabric swatches of the different types of mattress covering

definitions.definition: the basic structure of a society, an organization, etc. that enables it to function successfully

examples.text: a trend which threatens the very **fabric of society**
The government's policies have destroyed the social fabric.
the basic fabric of family life

definitions.definition: the basic structure of a building, such as the walls, floor and roof

examples.text: The city retains much of its historic fabric.

wordOrigin: late 15th cent.: from French fabrique, from Latin fabrica ‘something skilfully produced’, from faber ‘worker in metal, stone, etc.’ The word originally denoted a building, later a machine, the general sense being ‘something made’, hence sense (1) (mid 18th cent., originally denoting any manufactured material). Sense (2) dates from the mid 17th cent.
